Use a hash map to store numbers you've seen and their indices
As you iterate, check if the complement (target - current) is already in the map
explanation: We use a hash map to store each number and its index as we iterate. For each number, we check if its complement (target - num) exists in the map. If it does, we found our pair. If not, we add the current number to the map and continue. This gives us O(n) time complexity with a single pass through the array, compared to O(n^2) for the brute force approach.
